bibl.title: Letter from R. Hart Phillips to Philip Showalter Hench, October 26, 1940

div1.p: Phillips settles accounts with Hench for stenography and transcription work related to Hench's research in Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from R. Hart Phillips to Philip Showalter Hench, October 26, 1940

opener.dateline:
R. HART PHILLIPS
MANZANA DE GOMEZ 553-554.
HAVANA, CUBA.
Oct. 26, 1940.

div1.p:
I hope that you have received the necessary in-
formation.

I sent you the statement of Mr. Pogolotti personally
and Mr. Moran sent you that of Sra. Rojas and a statement by a
man (I have forgotten his name and have given the copies back to
Sra. Rojas). The first was stenographic work, the second transla-
tion.

Mr. Moran advised me that Mrs. Agramonte Rodriguez
Leon had sent her statement in. Frankly, I think with the copies
of the entries of the account book kept by the Rojas family that
your case is entirely complete and needs nothing else. However,
the last time I saw Moran he was finishing up data which he had
obtained for you, which I suppose you have received.
The work which I did was as follows:

I received your check for $20.00 and am therefore
enclosing you my personal check for $5.92 surplus.

Sorry that I could not get this done more rapidly
but time is required in this country for anything as perhaps Mr.
Moran told you. Very few people are in any hurry at all.

With best wishes and hoping the information was
satisfactory, I am
